p: Three essential oils viz., lemon grass, palm rosa and eucalyptus were tested against E. coli by exposing the bacterium to sub-MIC (1/2 of MIC) of each extract for 18 h at 37 °C, for 3 passages and then the culture was streaked on nutrient agar plates containing MIC of the extract and then incubated for 24 h at 37 °C. In this manner, the culture was tested 10 times making a total of 30 passages and assessed for the development of resistance to the given extract.
